title: Uber Revenue Jumps as Customers Go Out, Keep Ordering In
summary: Ride-hailing company sees higher gross bookings but slower growth. Uber Technologies Inc.'s revenue climbed 83% in the last quarter of 2021, helped by a recovery in its rides business and continued demand for food delivery despite restaurant reopenings.

title: Jan. 6 Committee Subpoenas Former Trump Adviser Peter Navarro
summary: Former trade adviser has described 'Green Bay Sweep' strategy to challenge swing-state vote results. WASHINGTON-The select committee investigating the pro-Trump Jan. 6 riot at the Capitol issued a subpoena to Peter Navarro, a former Trump administration adviser, saying that he had openly discussed a plan to stop the certification of President Biden's victory in the 2020 presidential election.

title: Sarah Bloom Raskin's Revolving Door
summary: How did her fintech firm mysteriously get a Fed master account?. We've told you about the desire of Sarah Bloom Raskin, President Biden's pick for Federal Reserve bank supervisor, to use regulatory power to choke off capital for fossil fuels. But she has another problem that you'd think even progressives would care about: how she parlayed her past government service into lucrative private work.

title: Senators Strike Bipartisan Deal on Violence Against Women Act
summary: Republicans had balked at Democrats' efforts to add language to bill that would have closed 'boyfriend loophole'. WASHINGTON-Senators have struck a bipartisan deal to reauthorize a landmark domestic-violence bill, after Democrats dropped their effort to add contentious language related to guns.

title: The U.K. Can Hit Putin Where It Hurts
summary: Tightening the screws on Russian wealth could help protect Ukraine.. While the U.S. and the European Union agree that Russia would face consequences for an expanded invasion of Ukraine, they're still debating how far sanctions should go and what would trigger them. As talks drag out in Washington and Brussels, the United Kingdom can move quickly to crack down on ill-gotten Russian wealth.

title: Stock-Trading Ban for Members of Congress Gains Traction
summary: Pelosi says she expects consensus to emerge pretty soon on legislation. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she expected Democrats to reach consensus on restricting stock trading by members of Congress and called for new rules for federal judges, as proposals competed for bipartisan support.

title: Ron Johnson's Oshkosh Heresy
summary: The GOP Senator won't interfere with a business decision. Good for him.. Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson has some nerve. The Republican is refusing to bully Oshkosh Corp. to manufacture United States Postal Service trucks in his home state. He deserves a taxpayer commendation.

title: Biden Says No Union, No Contract
summary: A new White House plan would steer federal funds toward Big Labor.. Joe Biden promised to be "the most pro-union President you've ever seen" before he took office, and he's spent a year struggling to show it. Now he's announced a new pro-union agenda, including plans to skirt the law by steering federal funds toward Big Labor.

title: New York State to Drop Indoor Mask Mandate
summary: Policy move comes as other Democratic-led states take similar steps to scale back Covid-19 restrictions. Nine states this week announced plans to roll back requirements that people wear masks at indoor venues, including businesses and, in some cases, schools, as Covid-19 case numbers decline and pressure to return to normal life rises.

title: Super Bowl 2022 Could Be Hottest on Record
summary: Temperatures in Los Angeles expected to be in the high 80s as National Weather Service issues a heat advisory. There is now one outcome fans can accurately predict for this Sunday's Super Bowl LVI: blazing hot weather.

summary: In the winter season, freshly promoted dancers seize their opportunities to shine.

summary: Entertainment giant gets a needed streaming boost-and a much more important profit lift. It's a good sign when Disney 's stream no longer has to float the ship.

summary: Lawmakers' letter says governors should have flexibility on use of funds from infrastructure bill.

title: Your 2022 Oscars Guide From WSJ Critics and Writers
summary: A collection of reviews and stories takes stock of this year's nominations in advance of the March 27 Academy Awards.. The nominees for the 94th Academy Awards were announced this week. Below you'll find a collection of excerpts from our critics' reviews of the films contending for Best Picture, along with links to the Journal's reviews and coverage of the movies in the running in the other categories.

title: U.K. Launches Review of Serious Fraud Office Over Unaoil Bribery Case
summary: Suella Braverman, the attorney general for England and Wales, has appointed David Calvert-Smith to lead the review. The attorney general for England and Wales has launched a review of the Serious Fraud Office over problematic issues identified in a bribery case linked to oil-services firm Unaoil Group.

title: How Feds Tracked Down Billions in Stolen Bitcoin
summary: U.S. government said couple acted to break up crypto transactions to make them harder to track. The U.S. government's $3.6 billion bitcoin bust this week appears to reflect its success five years ago in disrupting some operations used by criminals to launder stolen funds.

title: 'Free Speech' Review: How Dare You Say Such Things
summary: There are always reasons to try to shut some people up. The danger is not merely censorship but self-censorship.. A typical account of free-speech history will begin with John Milton's 1644 attack on censorship, "Areopagitica." To those who feared the publication of false and dangerous doctrines, Milton said, in essence, buck up: "Who ever knew Truth put to the worse in a free and open encounter?" A typical account will then note that Milton went on to write "Paradise Lost": A great poet and a great defense of free speech make an appealing pair. What probably won't be mentioned is that Milton, who wrote "Areopagitica" early in the English Civil War, served the victors as, among other things, a censor and propagandist. That's not so appealing, particularly if we know that other, forgotten, champions of free speech, like the radical democrat John Lilburne, were imprisoned under the regime Milton supported.

summary: Resume Subscription. Author

title: Toshiro Mifune: Bigger Than Life
summary: New York's Film Forum and the Criterion Channel present celebrations of the career of Toshiro Mifune, the cinematic embodiment of Japanese masculinity.

summary: Ms. Collins, who will have a voting role on the rate-setting committee, is set to take office July 1. The Federal Reserve Bank of Boston selected University of Michigan Provost Susan M. Collins as its next president, filling a vacancy left last year when Eric Rosengren moved forward his retirement following a controversy over his and other officials' financial-market trading.

title: Uganda Ordered to Pay Democratic Republic of the Congo $325 Million in Reparations
summary: The International Court of Justice ruled in 2005 that Kampala was liable in a conflict that left more than five million dead. The International Court of Justice has ordered Uganda to pay $325 million to the Democratic Republic of the Congo for the prolonged conflict that erupted between the two countries in the 1990s.

title: Will the Republican 2023 Agenda Arrive in Time for the 2022 Elections?
summary: How cleanly the party sweeps the midterms depends on a new legislative agenda.. Talk about telegraphing your punches! President Biden previewed the main Democratic midterm attack when he asked six times at his Jan. 19 press conference, "What are Republicans for?"

title: Boris Johnson: The U.K. Stands With Its Central European Allies
summary: Every nation has the right not to have its foreign policy and alliances dictated at gunpoint.. No one feels the tremors of Russia's military buildup on Ukraine's frontier more acutely than our allies on the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's eastern flank.

title: European Scientists Set Nuclear-Fusion Energy World Record
summary: The findings suggest this approach can be scaled-up for use in power plants. A device based at a U.K. facility in Oxfordshire has produced the highest sustained nuclear-fusion energy ever recorded, European researchers said Wednesday.

title: Infrastructure Law Becomes a Biden Union Giveaway
summary: A new executive order grants closed shops a monopoly on contracts greater than $35 million.. President Biden's repeated promises to be America's "most pro-union president" are about to cost taxpayers a fortune and undermine critical infrastructure investments.

title: Let's Turn Off the Olympics
summary: Political correctness is alive in Xi's China, but is losing support in the United States.. Needless to say, I won't be watching the Winter Olympics in China, where it's winter every day for the human spirit. Best of luck to our athletes, who are sentenced to performing in whichever country the endlessly disagreeable International Olympic Committee chooses. The IOC's Plan B choice for the Winter Olympics was Kazakhstan, last seen inviting in Vladimir Putin's army to crush antigovernment protests.

title: SEC Proposes Broad Disclosure Rules for Private Investment Funds
summary: Private-equity and hedge-fund managers would need to provide statements on fund performance, compensation, fees and expenses. WASHINGTON-Regulators proposed expansive new requirements for private investment funds Wednesday as part of a widening effort to police a rapidly growing but relatively opaque corner of the capital markets.

title: The Next Pig Thing in Medicine
summary: A man is still alive a month after a pig heart transplant.. I had my first kidney transplant in 2004. It gave out after 10 years. The replacement, which I received in 2016, functions well but won't last forever. "May your organ outlive you," older transplant patients tell each other. Otherwise, you may not survive the queue for a new one.

title: Nasdaq Jumps 2% as Stocks Extend Rally
summary: Uber Technologies, Walt Disney slated to post results after markets close. U.S. stocks rose and government-bond yields fell Wednesday following a recent climb, potentially easing some pressure on technology shares.

title: IFF Reaches Settlement Agreement With Carl Icahn
summary: Deal adds new independent director to big ingredient maker's board. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. reached a settlement agreement with activist investor Carl Icahn that will add a new director to the big ingredient maker's board.

title: CFTC Chair Asks Congress for Authority to Regulate Some Cryptocurrencies
summary: Lawmakers are considering whether agency needs additional authority to police market. WASHINGTON-The head of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission called on lawmakers Wednesday to grant his agency authority to regulate cryptocurrencies such as bitcoin, saying the "speculative fervor" around such assets has left investors in need of protection.

title: Russia Thrived as It Integrated With the West-a New Cold War Is Unraveling That
summary: A Ukraine invasion would trigger sweeping sanctions that cripple Russia's few knowledge industries and push it closer to China. Russia's annexation of Crimea in 2014 was an inflection point for globalization. The economic integration between east and west that began with the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 started to unravel.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX Seeks to Reconnect Tonga to Internet
summary: Last month's tsunami severed undersea cable that connected Pacific nation to world via Fiji. SYDNEY-SpaceX, the space-exploration company founded by Elon Musk, is seeking to establish a communications bridge to Tonga after last month's volcanic eruption and tsunami largely cut the Pacific nation off from the outside world, a senior Fijian lawmaker said.

title: Blackstone's Service King Kicks Off Debt Restructuring Talks
summary: Lenders to the collision-repair company have signed nondisclosure agreements ahead of a likely debt restructuring, which could include a potential bankruptcy filing. Blackstone Inc.'s Service King Collision Repair Centers Inc. has started talks with creditors about restructuring the company's debt, which could include a potential chapter 11 filing, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Migration Pattern (Thursday Crossword, February 10)
It Isn't 'Downton Abbey,' But It Is the Perfect Home for Them
summary: Resume Subscription. As a successful actor, Zoe Boyle is used to drama. But her many TV roles didn't prepare her for the turmoil involved when she and her cinematographer husband, Benedict Spence, tackled a major renovation project of their home in the middle of the pandemic.

title: Are Standing Desks Really Better for Your Back? It Depends...
summary: If used correctly, a standing desk is a good start, but those prone to pain might get more relief if they invest in these accessories-from anti-fatigue mats to a posture monitor.. DOCTORS, NO FANS of sedentary lifestyles, rarely encourage anyone-especially those with back pain-to spend all day sitting. A standing desk can help avert aching muscles if you use it correctly, get off your feet and move at regular intervals and-here's where we come in-consider investing in the right ergonomic accessories. If you insist on slouching in high heels on a concrete floor for hours, we can't help you.

title: How to Get Your Free N95 Masks From the U.S. Government
summary: Masks are available at most locations, with more arriving in coming days. Most U.S. residents can now pick up free N95 masks.

title: CVS Expects Sales Boost From Covid-19 to Wane
summary: Retail pharmacy company is evaluating acquisitions to expand reach into health services, CEO says. CVS Health Corp. got a sales boost from doling out more than 59 million Covid-19 vaccines and tens of millions of tests last year, but doesn't expect the same benefit this year, the company said Wednesday.

title: Biden Approves Plan to Help Americans Leaving Ukraine
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-The White House has approved a Pentagon plan for U.S. troops in Poland to help thousands of Americans likely to flee Ukraine if Russia attacks, as the Biden administration tries to avoid the kind of chaotic evacuation conducted in Afghanistan.

title: Los Angeles Home Asking $72.5 Million Has Sand Volleyball Court, Hookah Bar
summary: Resume Subscription. Less than a week after listing a $139 million Bel-Air spec house with glitzy amenities such as a vodka tasting room and nightclub, Los Angeles developer Joseph Englanoff is putting another big-ticket property on the market. This one, asking $72.5 million, is a West Hollywood spec house with an outdoor sand volleyball court and a hookah bar, according to Rayni Williams of the Beverly Hills Estates, one of the listing agents.

title: Does a Good $10 Wine Exist?
summary: Is a pleasing bottle at this price point too much to ask? Our wine columnist managed to find red, white and bubbly bargains that fit the bill, both drinkable and well made.. I RECENTLY went looking for wines that weren't easy to find. They weren't coveted grand crus from Burgundy or cult wines from Napa. My search was focused on something much more ordinary yet seemingly much more elusive: a good wine for $10 a bottle.

title: Hyundai, Kia Recall About 500,000 Vehicles and Warn of Fire Danger
summary: The auto makers are telling owners to park outside and away from buildings and other cars. Hyundai Motor Co. and Kia Corp. are asking the owners of nearly 500,000 vehicles in the U.S. to park outside because of malfunctions causing engine compartments to catch on fire.

title: Laid-Off Peloton Staffers Take to Social Media in New Job Hunt
summary: Some post testimonials, others share résumés; public spreadsheet with more than 250 former employees targets recruiters. Laid-off Peloton Interactive Inc. employees are posting testimonials on social media about their experiences at the company and sharing career details in efforts to find new employment after the fitness company cut 2,800 jobs Tuesday and replaced its chief executive.

title: Arizona Home Sells for $13.7 Million After Price Increase
summary: Resume Subscription. After a price increase, a home in Paradise Valley, Ariz., has sold for $13.7 million in one of the state's most expensive recorded home sales this year.

title: Covid-19 Hospitalizations Track Downward, 30% Off Peak
summary: Some U.S. governors are dropping some coronavirus restrictions, as U.K. government plans to lift all remaining curbs in England later this month. Hospitalizations continued tracking downward in the U.S., with the seven-day average of patients with confirmed or suspected Covid-19 falling to about 111,000, down 30% from a peak in January, according to data from the Department of Health and Human Services.

title: FinCEN's Corporate Ownership Rules Stir Debate
summary: While anticorruption groups lauded rules proposed to govern a new corporate ownership database, other stakeholders have concerns about the cost of complying. The U.S. Treasury Department is facing a wide range of views on the details of a corporate ownership database, more than a year after the agency was tasked with implementing a law that Congress hopes will help curtail the use of anonymous shell companies.

title: How to Answer When Asked for Your Pronouns
summary: Replying implies acceptance of the premise that humans can choose their gender, but refusal isn't always an option.. Colin Wright correctly points out that replying to the question, "What are your pronouns?" implies acceptance of the premise that humans can choose their gender ("When Asked for Your 'Pronouns,' Don't Answer," op-ed, Feb. 5). His suggestion not to reply to the pronoun impertinence makes good sense.

title: Investing for Social Good and the Long View
summary: Ignoring ESG issues over the long term will bring even higher costs for companies.. As a longtime ESG investor, I don't disagree with much of what James Mackintosh has written in "Streetwise: Why the Sustainable Craze Is Flawed" (Markets, Jan. 24). Understanding risk is what good investors do. The ESG marketing machine has gotten ahead of itself in what it promises investors.

title: With Big Russia Interests, German Firms Look to Putin for De-Escalation
summary: German companies have been among the most influential forces in the country pushing for continued dialogue with Russia in recent years. BERLIN-The leaders of some of Germany's biggest companies are set to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin early next month in a show of economic diplomacy aimed at urging all sides in the Ukraine standoff to back away from war.

title: Why Trump Really Lost Wisconsin in 2020
summary: It was those Republicans who split their tickets.. As a loyal Wisconsin Republican, I take issue with William Doyle's letter "The Role of Zuckerberg's Money in Wisconsin" (Feb. 3). Mr. Doyle writes that without Center for Tech and Civic Life involvement, "Wisconsin would have been a solidly red state in 2020."

title: You Can Keep That to Yourself
summary: The oversharing of emotions has become de rigueur.. In "Sparks in the New England Dark" (Books, Feb. 5), Sam Sacks toes the conventional line of lamenting "the strange habits of men who are incapable of discussing their emotions with one another." Am I a social freak for deeming such reticence a welcome respite from the oversharing of emotions that has become de rigueur in progressive circles nowadays?

title: Mayor Garcetti Has a Lot to Learn
summary: 'I hold my breath' won't cut it. Bill Clinton knew the way.. Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti could have avoided the public derision prompted by his "I hold my breath" defense to justify posing without a mask for a photo op with Magic Johnson (Notable & Quotable: Garcetti, Feb. 7). The tried-and-true progressive response is: "I didn't inhale."

title: U.S. Debates Whether a New Iran Deal Merits the Risks
summary: Critics say a restored nuclear accord would offer too few benefits for the U.S. and its allies. Prospects for a new but diminished Iran nuclear deal are increasing, prompting debate in Washington about whether an accord merits the compromises involved.

title: Microsoft Promises Openness on App Store
summary: The move is a response to concerns raised by app developers and lawmakers about competition. Microsoft Corp. executives promised that the marketplace they are envisioning for videogames would operate by a set of open-market principles, part of a pitch to regulators around the world to approve its acquisition of gaming giant Activision Blizzard Inc.

title: Intolerant Lawyers Shouldn't Be Judges
summary: Law school deans, faculty and students who stifle opposing views are unfit ever to sit on the bench.. What should be done about law-school deans and others in legal institutions who censor, cancel, blacklist, refuse to hire, fire, "investigate" and otherwise threaten others for their opinions? A partial answer lies in reminding them that their misconduct may disqualify them from ever sitting on the bench. At one point or another, most lawyers dream about being a judge. Lawyers and aspiring lawyers should remember that their conduct today may be the measure of their disqualification tomorrow.

title: Time to End the Covid Emergency
summary: Between Omicron's rise, layered immunity, and therapies, it's safe to treat the virus like the flu.. The time has come for states and the federal government to end their Covid declarations of emergency and the accompanying closures, restrictions, propaganda, distancing requirements, forced masking and vaccine mandates. Covid may circulate at some level forever, but Americans can now protect those vulnerable to it with standard medical procedures. They can treat it as they would the flu. Emergency measures need continuous justification and there isn't one anymore.

title: Fed's Mester Supports Moves to Accelerate Balance-Sheet Wind-Down
summary: The Cleveland Fed leader expects inflation to moderate but remain above 2% this year and next. Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Loretta Mester said Wednesday that as part of the central bank's looming effort to shrink the size of its nearly $9 trillion balance sheet, she'd support taking active measures to speed that process along.

summary: The ROC took gold in the team event but the IOC said a situation has come up which requires legal consultation with the International Skating Union. summary: Chipotle reported an earnings beat; Uber results are due after the close. Wall Street stocks rose and government bond yields are down following a recent climb. Here's what we're watching in Wednesday's trading:

summary: Mucked-up ports, freak storms, unfilled paper-mill jobs all have a hand in turning to-go cups and lids into one of the most precious goods in the U.S.. summary: Macron, Scholz and others are trying to preserve a post-Cold War order that European countries aren't prepared to forgo. summary: As we live longer, more people are caring for loved ones well into their retirement years. The U.S. population is aging, and so are caregivers.

summary: Insurers pass costs back to customers as inflation boosts prices for car repairs, replacements and rentals. Car insurers are rapidly raising rates to try to get ahead of inflation, which has boosted the prices of car repairs, replacements and rentals.

title: The Rams Are Hosting the Super Bowl. The Fans Will Be Rooting Against Them.
summary: After suffering through decades of mostly lousy football, Cincinnati Bengals fans are planning to show up at SoFi Stadium in large numbers to see their team play for a championship.. Andy Willinger knew he would find a way to attend the Super Bowl if his beloved Cincinnati Bengals made it there this season for the first time in 33 years. Not even his son's wedding shower on Saturday in Louisville, Ky., would stop him.

title: Things Got Dicey for the Garlic Girls. They're Back to Smash the Beijing Olympics.

summary: Resume Subscription. YEOSU, South Korea-His pregnant wife must swap traditional Afghan aush noodle soup for instant ramen. His oldest son practices swirling taekwondo kicks at night. He has been told he will have to apologize if he leaves work before his colleagues.

summary: Resume Subscription. title: Toyota, Honda Strike Pessimistic Note About Car Supply This Year

summary: An emotional send-off in Argentina for a gifted player whose body seldom complied. He's the heartbreak giant.

title: Covid Vaccine Protests Disrupt Traffic on U.S.-Canada Bridge

title: Toyota's Real Challenge Is EVs, Not Chips
summary: Global supply-chain woes are affecting car maker too, but even bigger problem looms round corner. The world's largest car maker is finally hitting the chip-shortage speed bump which curbed growth across the industry last year. Given Toyota 's deft driving so far and a probable partial improvement in supply-chain snarls this year, that problem likely won't last.

title: Mortgage Firms Might Find Fewer Matches This Valentine's Day
summary: Pool of homeowners who have good credit and could see big gains from refinancing is shrinking fast. Mortgage rates are still pretty decent for potential borrowers, but their rapid jump has still been enough to cause more problems for home-lending stocks.

title: U.S. Households Took On $1 Trillion in New Debt in 2021
summary: Increase is largest since 2007 and was largely result of big jump in mortgages, auto loans. Americans took on more new debt in 2021 than in any year since before the 2008-09 financial crisis.

title: Nathan Chen's Yellow Brick Road to Gold
summary: He doesn't just learn his music on ice. He also learns it on piano. Now the American figure skater is an Elton John medley away from being the Olympic champion.. title: Ford, GM Warn Dealers About Charging Above Sticker Price
summary: Auto makers try to curb the practice of adding fees to the suggested retail price, saying tactic could cost dealerships future vehicle inventory. Ford Motor Co. and General Motors Co. are clamping down on dealerships that are trying to charge more than the sticker price, a tactic that has proliferated amid the car shortage.

title: Nvidia, SoftBank Call Off World's Biggest Chip Deal
summary: SoftBank revives plans to take the U.K.-based chip-design specialist public, aims to launch IPO before the end of next fiscal year. Nvidia Corp. and Japan's SoftBank Group Corp. are abandoning a blockbuster deal for the U.S. semiconductor giant to acquire chip-design specialist Arm after regulators raised antitrust concerns.

title: SoftBank Pitches IPO for Arm After Deal With Nvidia Falls Through
summary: Antitrust concerns scrap sale of chip designer that could have brought $80 billion to Japanese tech investor, but CEO Masayoshi Son sees an upside. TOKYO-After a deal that could have been worth $80 billion to his company fell apart, SoftBank Group Corp. Chief Executive Masayoshi Son is playing salesman for Plan B-an initial public offering of chip designer Arm.

title: The U.S. Waited Six Days for a Gold Medal. Lindsey Jacobellis Waited 16 Years.
summary: The longest Winter Olympics gold drought in Team USA history came to an end in snowboard cross. The U.S.'s six-day wait for a gold medal in Beijing seemed almost interminable. Never before in the history of the Winter Olympics had the Americans taken so long to reach the top step of a podium. But the drought came to end on Wednesday with one athlete who truly knows what it means to be patient.

title: SPACs Are the New Money-Market Funds
summary: Blank-check vehicles may now be in demand more as sources of risk-free arbitrage than as ways to invest in exciting startups. Investing in SPACs isn't about the adrenaline rush it used to be.

title: LinkedIn Might Just Be the Best Social Network
summary: CEO Ryan Roslansky lays out new features arriving on the professional networking platform, including a no-politics button and live video and audio events. I'm ready to speak my truth:

title: U.S. Fights Information War With Russia to Deter Ukraine Invasion
summary: Public airing of secret intelligence about Kremlin's plans aims to avert a Russian attack. Russian troops are poised near Ukraine's borders and U.S. officials warn that an invasion could come any day. But an information war between Moscow and the West has been under way for months.

title: Savers Unlikely to Benefit From Fed Interest Rate Rise
summary: Banks are unlikely to pay depositors more after the Fed first lifts rates because the lenders don't need the money. Interest rates are about to rise. Savers shouldn't get their hopes up.

title: China's Quant Hedge Funds Stumble After Breakneck Growth
summary: Recent setbacks suggest the industry is hitting headwinds, including increasing competition to exploit market inefficiencies. Some data-driven Chinese hedge funds have stumbled, after several years of eye-catching returns and surging inflows from investors.

title: Amid Staff Shortages, National Guard Takes On Unexpected Missions
summary: Resume Subscription. When Simon Hammond signed up for the National Guard in New Mexico nearly three years ago, he hoped to gain some new experiences and challenges. He never imagined he would be teaching eighth-grade algebra.

title: China's Secret Olympic Edge: The Skeleton Course
summary: The host nation is on a three-Olympics win streak in the men's event. Home-track advantage is even bigger in Beijing.. Yanqing, China

title: 'Inventing Anna' TV Review: Hate-Watching a Haute Hustler
summary: The Netflix series tells the true-and-false story of scamming socialite Anna Delvey. The "hate watch" as a programming calculation reaches an apotheosis with "Inventing Anna," which makes its perverse intentions clear from the opening voiceover: "This whole show-the one you're about to sit on your fat ass and watch like a big lump of nothing-is about me." OK, then: Let's settle our collective posterior on the couch.

title: Instead of Two Beijing Olympics Medals, Mikaela Shiffrin Has Two Misfires
summary: The U.S. ski star skidded out of her second race in three days. 'I've never been in this position before and I don't know how to handle it,' she said.. Yanqing, China

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: UCLA to Pay $243.6 Million to Sexual-Abuse Accusers
summary: Settlement covers cases involving 203 women who said they were groped or otherwise abused by Dr. James Heaps. LOS ANGELES-The University of California has agreed to pay $243.6 million to settle allegations that hundreds of women were sexually abused by a former UCLA gynecologist, lawyers and the university announced Tuesday.

title: Ex-Boeing Pilot to Face Fewer Charges as Judge Trims Criminal Case
summary: U.S. district judge dismisses part of criminal case stemming from 737 MAX crashes in late 2018 and early 2019. A federal judge dismissed part of the criminal case against a former Boeing Co. pilot accused of misleading air-safety regulators about faulty software that played a significant role in two deadly 737 MAX crashes.

title: U.S. Adds China's Wuxi Biologics to 'Unverified List'; Shares Dive
summary: Listing restricts an entity's ability to receive U.S. exports. HONG KONG-The shares of one of China's most valuable biotechnology companies plummeted Tuesday, losing almost a quarter of their value after the U.S. Commerce Department flagged concerns about the firm to American exporters.

title: House Passes Bill Easing Retiree Burdens for U.S. Postal Service
summary: Long-sought changes would enroll retirees in Medicare and end agency's requirement to prefund benefits. WASHINGTON-The House passed legislation designed to keep the U.S. Postal Service financially viable, including by repealing a requirement that it prefund retiree health benefits, sending the measure to the Senate, where it also has broad support.

title: U.S. Seizes $3.6 Billion in Bitcoin Stolen in 2016 Hack
summary: The value of the bitcoin at the time it was seized last week marks the department's largest-ever financial seizure. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department said Tuesday it seized over $3.6 billion worth of digital currency stolen during a hack of a cryptocurrency exchange and arrested two suspects for allegedly trying to launder the proceeds.

title: Trevor Bauer Won't Face Criminal Charges on Sexual-Assault Allegations
summary: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher could still face discipline from Major League Baseball. Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer won't face criminal charges stemming from allegations that he sexually assaulted a San Diego woman last year, the Los Angeles County district attorney's office said Tuesday.

title: 'Intimate Apparel' Review: A Beautifully Stitched Opera
summary: The operatic adaptation of Lynn Nottage's play marries the best of its love-and-loss narrative to Ricky Ian Gordon's musical talents in Bartlett Sher's production.

title: McConnell Says RNC Shouldn't Have Censured Cheney and Kinzinger
summary: Many Republican lawmakers have criticized 'legitimate political discourse' language in resolution. WASHINGTON-Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R., Ky.) criticized the Republican National Committee's censure of two Republican lawmakers who sit on the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol, saying the RNC shouldn't single them out for holding differing views from the majority of the party.

title: Chipotle CEO Says Another Menu-Price Increase Likely
summary: Burrito chain says higher menu prices helped lift sales recently as it looks to expand. Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. said it increased menu prices again and is likely to raise them further this year, as its chief executive officer said higher costs are unlikely to abate.

title: Omnicom Gets Boost From Helping Marketers Reach Consumers Directly
summary: The ad agency holding company said its precision marketing group saw organic growth of 19% in 2021. Omnicom Group Inc. said its precision marketing group, which helps its clients reach consumers directly through digital platforms, underpinned revenue gains in the fourth quarter and in 2021 as a whole as marketers tried to navigate the shifting landscape.
